com.explodingbacon.bcnlib.vision

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.explodingbacon.bcnlib.vision.Camera

  • public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
    A wrapper class for OpenCV's VideoCapture object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Camera

        public Camera(int index,
              boolean autoUpdate)
        Creates a new Camera.
        Parameters:
        index - The ID of the Camera, 0-indexed. If there is only one Camera available, it should be ID 0.
        autoUpdate - If this Camera should keep the frames served by Camera.getImage() up to date.

    • Method Detail

      • isUpdatingEnabled

        public boolean isUpdatingEnabled()
        Checks if the auto updating for this Camera is enabled. This is NOT used to check if the Camera is in auto updating mode. Use isAutoUpdating() for that.
        Returns:
        If the auto updating for this Camera is enabled.

      • setUpdatingEnabled

        public void setUpdatingEnabled(boolean u)
        Sets if the auto updating for this Camera is enabled.
        Parameters:
        u - The new status of the auto updating.

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Checks if this Camera is open.
        Returns:
        If this Camera is open.

      • isAutoUpdating

        public boolean isAutoUpdating()
        Checks if this Camera is auto updating its frames.
        Returns:
        If this Camera is auto updating its frames.

      • onEachFrame

        public void onEachFrame(java.util.function.Consumer<Image> c)
        Sets the code that runs every time a frame is processed. Set this to null if you want no code to run.
        Parameters:
        c - The code to be run.

        public Image getImage()
        Gets the current Image on this Camera.

        The current Image on this Camera.

        public boolean setFPS(double d)
        Sets the FPS of this Camera. TODO: Figure out why this doesn't work. This should help: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7039575/how-to-set-camera-fps-in-opencv-cv-cap-prop-fps-is-a-fake
        Parameters:
        d - The new FPS.
        Returns:
        If the operation was successful.

      • getRaw

        public double getRaw(int propid)
        Gets the value of an OpenCV property.
        Parameters:
        propid - The property ID. Should be a variable defined in Videoio.
        Returns:
        The value of an OpenCV property.

      • setRaw

        public boolean setRaw(int propid,
                      double val)
        Sets the value of an OpenCV property.
        Parameters:
        propid - The property ID. Should be a variable defined in Videoio.
        val - The value to set the property to.
        Returns:
        If changing the property was successful.
